Authors:
Shi-Ke Huang, Dhanushka Nadeeshan Wanasinghe, Ishara
Manawasinghe, Ji-Chuan KANG, Timur S. Bulgakov
Title:
Morphology and phylogeny of Dematiopleospora fusiformis sp.
nov. (Phaeosphaeriaceae)
Abstract:
Dematiopleospora fusiformis sp. nov. was isolated from a
decaying upright stem of Achillea sp. (Asteraceae) collected from the
Rostov Region of Russia. The new taxon shares with D. mariae, the type
species of Dematiopleospora, features such as unilocular ascomata, with
brown setae in the ostiole, cylindrical asci and fusiform, muriform
ascospores. However, D. fusiformis differs morphologically from the type
and other species in Dematiopleospora in having larger asci and
ascospores. Phylogenetic analyses of combined ITS, SSU and LSU sequence
data also placed this species in Dematiopleospora. Maximum likelihood
and Bayesian inference analyses revealed it to group closely with
Dematiopleospora mariae and D. cirsii, but to be a distinct species. The
new species, is introduced with a comprehensive description and
microphotographs and is compared with the most similar species in the
genus.
